case_vignette: a 4-year-old boy is brought to the physician by his parents because of concerns about his behavior during the past year. his parents report that he often fails to answer when they call him and has regular unprovoked episodes of crying and screaming. at kindergarten, he can follow and participate in group activities, but does not follow his teacher's instructions when these are given to him directly. he is otherwise cheerful and maintains eye contact when spoken to but does not respond when engaged in play. he gets along well with friends and family. he started walking at the age of 11 months and can speak in two-to-three-word phrases. he often mispronounces words.
question: which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Pediatrics and Neonatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I often fail to answer when called, and I have regular unprovoked episodes of crying and screaming.
How old are you?
I am 4 years old.
Does your child have any delays in speech or language skills?
Yes, I often mispronounce words and speak in two-to-three-word phrases.
Have there been any changes in social interactions, such as reduced eye contact or interest in people?
No, I maintain eye contact when spoken to and get along well with friends and family.
Do the episodes of crying and screaming occur mostly during changes in routine or in response to specific triggers?
The episodes of crying and screaming are unprovoked.
Does your child have a history of ear infections or hearing issues?
The information provided does not mention any history of ear infections or hearing issues.
Has your child had a hearing test, and if so, what were the results?
The information provided does not mention if I have had a hearing test or the results of any such test.
Final Diagnosis: Autism Spectrum Disorder

trial_0.summarized_conversation: A subject, who is 4 years old, regularly has episodes where they fail to respond when called and experiences unprovoked episodes of crying and screaming. The subject often mispronounces words and communicates primarily in two-to-three-word phrases. However, they maintain eye contact when spoken to and have positive interactions with friends and family. There are no noted incidents of ear infections or hearing complications, and it is unclear whether the subject has undergone a hearing test or what the results might have been if such a test was conducted.
